title: Understanding Large-Scale Transfer Learning-Based Indoor Positioning Systems

context.prior_knowledge: Familiarity with fundamental machine learning concepts and general understanding of indoor positioning systems
context.additional_context: A course exploring AI technology applications for real-world problem-solving. Focuses on the operating principles of fingerprint-based location recognition systems and transfer learning methodologies.

learning_goals: Explain the basic principles of transfer learning and its application cases in indoor positioning systems.
Understand the role of metric learning in the indoor positioning estimation process using fingerprint data.

Within a 1-week course, learners derive performance improvement results of 10% or higher in the target domain using a pre-trained model from the source domain for three provided metric transfer cases (e.g., image classification across domains) and write an experimental report.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
